comments.body: @yxieca @lolyu please help review.

@liushilongbuaa most if not all of the CodeQL analysis workflows got set up with `pull_request_target` instead of `pull_request` trigger. That causes the code version that gets checked to be the current version of the target branch, but without the changes getting merged in. Can you make PRs for the other repos to fix that?
@saiarcot895 , pull_request_target also has its benefits. Change all repos trigger to pull_request may be not necessary.
@zjswhhh can you look into the build failures?

comments.body:
> Does `active-active` dualtor have the same issue? And can you add a UT to cover the scenario?

`active-active` won't have this issue, `active-active` has periodical gRPC query at least.

> Stop sending heatbeats when losing default route is by design.
> 
> If you want to change this behavior, then you need to tie the behavior with ignoring default route missing configuration entry.

Hi @yxieca - here we are talking about **mux probe**, not link probe (the heartbeat). The PR is fixing a state machine edge case. By design, it's expected to see **mux probe** when state is unhealthy.
@yxieca - please help review again?
Please add ADO number in PR description.

> Please add ADO number in PR description.

Done.

reviews.body:
Does `active-active` dualtor have the same issue?
And can you add a UT to cover the scenario?

Stop sending heatbeats when losing default route is by design.

If you want to change this behavior, then you need to tie the behavior with ignoring default route missing configuration entry.

> Please add ADO number in PR description.

Done
@zjswhhh I am wondering if repeat the query when inconsistent is detected would be a better solution? Delaying query sounds like a work-around that could fail.

> @zjswhhh I am wondering if repeat the query when inconsistent is detected would be a better solution? Delaying query sounds like a work-around that could fail.

Hi Ying - when this issue happens, we do repeat the query because of the inconsistency (cable firmware keeps return false value which is inconsistent to heartbeat state). 

The true fix is to update cable firmware, but if this inconsistency doesn't resolve, we will have `unhealthy` label, and any upgrade  will just be blocked.
Also the query is not only delayed, it will be **cancelled** if linkmgrd state is `healthy` when timer expires.
